SEARCH
Package com.nickslibrary.datastructures.linear

Class Deque<T>

java.lang.Object
com.nickslibrary.datastructures.linear.Deque<T>
Type Parameters:
T - The type of elements stored in the deque.
public class Deque<T> extends Object
A Deque (Double-Ended Queue) implementation using a doubly linked list. Supports insertion and deletion from both front and rear in O(1) time.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    Deque()
    Constructs an empty deque using a doubly linked list.

      Adds an element to the rear of the deque.
      Parameters:
      data - The element to add.

    • removeFront

      public T removeFront()
      Removes and returns the front element of the deque.
      Returns:
      The removed element, or null if the deque is empty.
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if the deque is empty

    • removeRear

      public T removeRear()
      Removes and returns the rear element of the deque.
      Returns:
      The removed element, or null if the deque is empty. * @throws IllegalStateException if the deque is empty

    • peekFront

      public T peekFront()
      Retrieves, but does not remove, the front element of the deque.
      Returns:
      The front element, or null if the deque is empty.

    • peekRear

      public T peekRear()
      Retrieves, but does not remove, the rear element of the deque.
      Returns:
      The rear element, or null if the deque is empty.

    • isEmpty

      public boolean isEmpty()
      Checks if the deque is empty.
      Returns:
      True if the deque is empty, false otherwise.

      public int size()
      Returns the number of elements in the deque.
      Returns:
      The size of the deque.

    • clear

      public void clear()
      Clears the deque, removing all elements.

    • contains

      public boolean contains(T data)
      Checks if the deque contains a specific element.
      Parameters:
      data - The element to check for.
      Returns:
      True if the element is found, false otherwise.

    • toArray

      public T[] toArray()
      Returns an array representation of the deque.
      Returns:
      An array containing all elements in the deque.

      public void printDeque()
      Prints the deque elements in order.

      public void reverse()
      Reverses the deque although who knows why you'd want to.
